title: DJI's new FPV Drone!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: - Hey guys, it's Justine, and today we have a very exciting unboxing. I know I say that quite often, but this is something all new from DJI. This is their first little baby steps into FPV drone flying. FPV drones are completely different than most of the consumer drones that most of us are used to flying. I've done some FPV flying before, but not really that much. So I'm very excited to test this out without further ado, We're gonna unbox, and get to it. (upbeat music) Oh my goodness. Oh, it's heavy. Heavy boy. (headset rolling) Controller. Let's get everything out. Gosh, there's so many goodies in here. This is an authentic smile. Sometimes I smile and I'm crying inside, but this is real, there are no tears inside. Holy crap. I can't wait to take this out. Looks like this is the propellers. So this is the "A" propellers. (unboxing) This is the B propeller box. They're also red tips. I thought we were gonna get like a different tip color. So to be able to identify which one is the "A" and which one is the "B," You'll see the inner circle of the "A" is red, the "B" is black. (assembling) Oh shoot. Look at this, Oh boy. We've got some more boxes. (unboxing) That is a very large power adopter. What is this? (gasps) Oh my gosh I can change his outfit. Oh. Oh, wow. Look at all of this. (bight upbeat music) We're all gonna end up walking around like this one day you know, hi, I'm Justine nice to meet you, I'm COVID negative. So here's everything that came inside of the fly more combo kit. Now the cool thing about this is yes, it is an FPV drone so you can fly a traditional FPV. So if you do take your hands off the throttles, the drone is going to drop out of the air. But they also have the modes that we're familiar with in previous DJI drones, so you can fly this normally. This is really great way to ease your way into FPV drone flying. The only thing that I do want to note is FPV drone flying has been around for a really long time, and a lot of these pilots have worked so hard to create their own drones. Most of them are made basically from scratch. This is a way to make it more accessible, but I don't want that to discredit all of the hard work and effort, and the time that all of these pilots have put in. The years of building and perfecting their drones. I see you, we see you. We don't forget. I'm a noob, (laughs), hi. Time to charge up the batteries, update the firmware, and I've got a lot to learn. (calm music) (bright upbeat music) I've never been afraid to fly a drone before but this is something that's entirely different. I'm not very comfortable flying FPV. So this is kind of really like my first big leap into it. Now the good thing about this drone though, is I can fly it like a normal Mavic, which I'm incredibly comfortable with, but you could flip this thing into sport mode and you can go so fast but thankfully there's really not a lot of stuff that I can hit out here. The real question that I'm asking myself is, am I going to be brave enough to pop this into manual for the first time in this video? I'm not entirely sure. I'm a little bit nervous. I feel like I kind of want to work up to it cause I don't wanna crash the drone. I have been doing the in-flight tutorials. There's an app where you can race in different settings. Kind of like a simulator, but nothing simulates real life. Okay. Let's just do this. Let's just do it. So here she is. Oh wow. That is aggressive. Nothing about this drone is subtle, at all. All right. No better time than now. This is weird. It's like I'm outside my body. (drone flying) (car engine roaring) (bright upbeat music) I got so close to his car. Holy crap. That was so scary. You guys, I'm still learning my controls. Yes, okay. Return to home. I'm just testing it out. I normally, for me personally I never liked to do return to home. I like to manually land myself. Surprisingly not feeling much motion sickness, as I thought that I would have. When I'm playing the simulator, I do feel a little bit of motion sickness, but because maybe like I'm sitting, stable, not moving my head a lot, I feel pretty good. I can't believe how much fun I'm having. Dude, I almost hit you. I'd love to take off on one more flight. The problem is, these batteries Aren't charging fast enough, and I only have three. So this is my third flight, and this is something that I really wanna test out. This is the motion controller, so this is kind of an all new way to control the drone. It's basically gesture controlled. Here's your acceleration. There's a break . So I'm not gonna try the motion controller out just yet, I'm still getting my bearings and I also only have one battery left. So I wanna get a couple more flights in before we don't have any batteries left. I am very excited though, because I am gonna be meeting up with some of my friends and we're gonna do an FPV drone course race together. So I need to practice up and get ready for the big race. Not confident in my skills yet but we'll see what happens. She's going in. (drone flying) I am preparing for the tournament tomorrow. There's a big race that's happening with Jesse and some fellow pilots. I'm so dusty. Going in. - Left, towards Jenna, towards me, Up, up. - So that's the problem (drone flying) Whoa (bright upbeat music) So we're in Oxnard right now, and there is a drone competition that is about to take place behind me. They have this course all set up. There are small little gates. It's very close quarters. And this type of flying is something that I don't ever do. I'm so used to flying just my Mavic drone, getting cool cinematic shots. This is completely different. - When you're in the FPV it's so much faster. The other thing that I've never experienced in FPV is the proximity sensing there. So the jerk that I am, I tried to thread the needle going down these orange roads, and it slowed it down, like a really consistent slowdown. Then was like, "Hey bro, it's kind of a lot of (beep) right now." And like, it kept me from being reckless. Is the pinch technique something I should know about? - It is - That's what I use - Really? - But I wouldn't. - I go gamer techniques. I go like call of duty (indistinct) - I do too. But you can't do that. - You get more precise this way. - Yeah. (drone flying) (all cheering) - I guess I'm up first. (bright upbeat music) - This is so cool. This is such a fun course. If you guys want to check out the full video that Jesse did I'll put a link in the description, and is my forehead dented? Yep, that is. (car drifting) - Well thank you guys so much for watching. I had so much fun testing out this drone. I love flying FPV. The thing that I do need to do is practice a little bit more, but this kind of really opened up my eyes to what's possible. And the fact that DJI is making this easier and accessible for more people just start flying. It's really cool, and I'm so excited to see what the future of this all looks like. - I have no idea where it is. - It's coming up for us. Like, quick. (upbeat music)
